thread.title: TED-Ed at Bharati Vidyapeeth Rabindranath Tagore school of excellence (BVRTSE), 3rd edition | Pune News - The Times of India
thread.title_full: TED-Ed at Bharati Vidyapeeth Rabindranath Tagore school of excellence (BVRTSE), 3rd edition | Pune News - The Times of India

author: Swati Shinde
title: TED-Ed at Bharati Vidyapeeth Rabindranath Tagore school of excellence (BVRTSE), 3rd edition | Pune News - The Times of India
text:
PUNE: Bharati Vidyapeeth Rabindranath Tagore School of Excellence (BVRTSE), is all set to host its third TED-Ed event on Friday, 19 September 2025. Building on the momentum of its past two successful editions, this thought-provoking platform will once again spotlight the voices of young changemakers as they take the stage to share original ideas worth spreading, a statement issued by the school said. The event aims to spark curiosity, challenge perspectives and inspire action while reflecting BVRTSE’s vision of nurturing critical thinking, creativity and a global outlook in its students. It is a celebration of youth-led inquiry where personal stories, intellectual explorations and bold questions come together to ignite conversations that extend beyond the classroom. This year’s speaker line up features a rich range of topics: Ayan Jain (Grade 11) Can Anger Be the Fuel for Greatness? Kabir Dashotter (Grade 12) From Obsession to Awareness: Overcoming Celebrity Worship Riddhi Jadgav (Grade 11) The Gratitude of Infinity in Every Moment of Our Finite Life Diva Malik (Grade 10B) Writing: The Most ‘Human’ Thing Dev Turakhia (Grade 12) Great Expectations Thriving in an Absurd World Gargi Hardikar (Grade 12) Does It Matter If No One Notices? Divit Jagatram (Grade 9A) Invisible Canons How Algorithms Are Commanding Our Attention Aanya Khare (Grade 9B) Problem is No Problem No Problem is a Problem Gargi Jena A Guide to Quiet Panic Team Performance Against the Static Exploring a Garden of Sound You Can Also Check: Pune AQI | Weather in Pune | Gold Rate Today in Pune | Silver Rate Today in Pune With such compelling ideas on offer, the 2025 edition promises to be an inspiring experience for all.
About the Author Swati Shinde Swati Shinde is a senior correspondent at The Times of India, Pune, and covers school education and research institutes, and keeps in touch with researchers involved in various disciplines. She is a sports enthusiast, plays badminton and loves trekking. Read More
